item.title: Jonas add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "I am only an experimenter. Do not set the least value on what I do, or the least discredit on what I do not, as if I pretended to settle any thing as true or false. I unsettle all things. No facts are to me sacred; none are profane; I simply experiment, an endless seeker." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "No truth so sublime but it may be trivial to-morrow in the light of new thoughts. People wish to be settled: only as far as they are unsettled is there any hope for them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Every man supposes himself not to be fully understood; and if there is any truth in him ... I see not how it can be otherwise." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "There are no fixtures in nature. The universe is fluid and volatile." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Simone Weil
item.description: "Everything beautiful has a mark of eternity." -- Simone Weil

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Every thing looks permanent until its secret is known." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Gregory of Nyssa
item.description: "Concepts create idols; only wonder grasps anything." -- Gregory of Nyssa

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Ron Sukenick
item.description: "If you don't use your imagination someone else will use it for you." -- Ron Sukenick

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Where there is no love there is no understanding." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jonas add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "God guard me from those thoughts men think In the mind alone." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Our moods do not believe in each other. To-day I am full of thoughts and can write what I please. I see no reason why I should not have the same thought, the same power of expression, to-morrow. What I write, whilst I write it, seems the most natural thing in the world: but yesterday I saw a dreary vacuity in this direction in which now I see so much; and a month hence, I doubt not, I shall wonder who he was that wrote so many continuous pages." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Men cease to interest us when we find their limitations." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "This surface on which we now stand is not fixed, but sliding." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The energy of the mind is commensurate with the work to be done." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "We'll invent new ways of being together." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "That's the good thing about being halved. One understands the sorrow of every person and thing in the world at its own incompleteness. I was whole and did not understand, and moved about deaf and unfeeling amid the pain and sorrow all round us, in places where as a whole person one would least think to find it. Itâ€™s not only me . . . who am a split being, but you and everyone else too. Now I have a fellowship which I did not understand, did not know before, when whole, a fellowship with all the mutilated and incomplete things in the world." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Jonas add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Beauty is its own excuse for being." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson
